citeinfo.origin: Harvard University. Center for Geographic Analysis.

citeinfo.title: Zhejiang Sheng, China : Towns

pubinfo.publish: Harvard Map Collection, Harvard College Library

descript.abstract:
Vector dataset showing populated places (with names in Russian) over an area of the Zhejiang Sheng region, China, 1979. Dataset was derived from 6 sheet maps from a series of Soviet Army topographic maps of China 1:200,000, prepared and printed by the Soviet Army General Headquarters, 1976-1991.
Source maps were scanned and georeferenced to the Gauss-Kruger projection by Harvard Map Collection staff. Roads were traced and points were placed in ArcMap from the GeoTIFF using heads-up digitizing by East View Cartographic, Inc.
descript.purpose: Dataset was produced to create a vector dataset of the populated places (with names in Russian) over the Zhejiang Sheng region of China for the Harvard University Center for Geographic Analaysis. Data was created March 2007 from available Soviet 200K source maps held in the Harvard Map Collection.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.780

srcinfo.srccontr: Georeferenced TIFF files from which vector data was derived.

procstep.procdesc:
1. Soviet 200K source maps supplied by Harvard University Center for Geographic Analysis. GeoTIFFs in Gauss-Kruger, Pulkovo, zn20.
2. Feature Extraction:
a.) Data is sent to subcontractor for feature extraction. b.) Raster is opened in MapInfo 8.5. c.) New layer is created according to specifications. d.) Map is set to digitizing level (same as source map scale: 1:200,000) e.) Nodes are placed for polygons. Nodes are placed as to simulate the "real" geographic nature of the line. For coastlines the contour is smooth (more nodes) for country borders - more "edge-like". f.) After all polygons are created, attributes are assigned in the object list. - Screen is centered on the object from the list - All attributes are read from the raster and put into the attribute table. - Russian names were assigned in cyrillic. g.) Operator will check that data is complete and do a selective check of object attributes (spelling, etc.) h.) Data is exported to ArcGIS. i.) Polygon topology is verified. j.) Shapefiles are opened in MapInfo and saved for export. k.) Project Manager will QC datasets and send back for rework as necessary. i.) Dataset is sent back to East View for final check. Corrections are made by East View, or sent back for subcontractor to correct if needed.

The ArcGIS 9.2 Feature Class to Feature Class tool was used to move the geographic shapes into SDE without any attribute information except for an ID number. Microsoft Access was used to create an XML file containing just the attributes from the shape file, including the UTF8 encoded Cyrillic names. The XML file was imported to a new table in Oracle using SQLLoader with the NLS_CHARACTERSET property set to UTF8. The attributes were then joined back to the shapes using SQLPlus with the NLS_LANGUAGE property set to Russian. This process ensured that the UTF8 encoding was properly interpreted during the import.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
